description: Feather reed grass (Calamagrostis acutiflora 'Overdam') is an amazing ornamental grass that adds texture and colour to the garden. A cool-season grass, it features slender, bright green leaves and tall graceful plumes that sway in the breeze. The leaves are one and a half times as long as they are wide, with a silvery white mid-rib, giving the blades a unique two-tone appearance. The small blooms open in June and turn to a buff-coloured shade by the end of August. Chickadees and goldfinches love to perch on the feathery blooms. Deer and drought tolerant, this grass is long-lived and low maintenance, providing year-round interest and beauty.
